site_branding.name: iNTECH PROPERTIES LTD
site_branding.address: iNTECH AMIN GARDEN, 134/15 Furfura Sharif Road, Darussalam, Dhaka 1207

properties.title: iNTECH SHOPNOCHURA
properties.content:
Features & Amenities

Electrical Wiring & Fittings

  • Concealed PVC conduit wiring with standard quality cables
  • Standard quality electrical fittings and fixtures (developer selected)
  • Dedicated air-conditioner power point in the master bedroom

Bathroom Features

  • All water supply lines are fully concealed
  • Standard local sanitary fittings and fixtures with guarantee
  • Mirror provided in all bathrooms
  • Ceramic wall tiles (8″×12″) and floor tiles (12″×12″) from Mir / Fu-Wang / R.A.K / CBC
  • PVC bathroom door frame and shutter

Kitchen Features

  • Wall tiles (8″×12″) up to 7 feet height from floor
  • Ceramic tiled kitchen flooring
  • Double burner gas outlet with concrete platform
  • Stainless steel countertop sink
  • Concrete shelves at standard working height
  • Properly positioned exhaust fan

General Facilities

  • Secured gated entrance with wide driveway
  • Covered and protected car parking
  • Well-planned reception lobby and security post at ground floor
  • Generator backup for lift and common areas
  • Two light points and one fan point in each apartment
  • Intercom system connected to the guard room

Architectural Design

  • Modern and disciplined layout planning
  • Maximum natural light and air circulation
  • Efficient cross-ventilation in all apartments

Structural Features

  • RCC Moment Resisting Frame (MRF) structure
  • Heavy RCC foundation and first-class brick walls
  • Earthquake resistant design (BNBC Zone-II compliant)
  • High-quality cement used in all RCC members
  • Deformed mild steel bars (BSRM / Kabir / Equivalent)
  • Special heat-resistant roof treatment

Paint & Finishing

  • Premium plastic paint on internal walls and ceilings
  • Weather-resistant waterproof paint on exterior walls

Doors

  • Imported main entrance door with safety lock, check viewer & apartment number
  • Flush / PVC / imported veneer internal doors (developer selected)
  • Solid wood door frames except for bathrooms

Windows

  • Sliding aluminum windows with 5mm tinted glass
  • Safety grills with matching enamel paint

Flooring

  • Premium ceramic floor tiles (12″×12″) from Mir / Fu-Wang / R.A.K

properties.title: iNTECH BAYAZID PARK
properties.content:
iNTECH Bayazid Park is a modern residential apartment project located in the heart of Kallyanpur, Dhaka. The project is situated in the S. A. Khaleq Residential Area, near Darus Salam Tower and Gabtoli Bus Stand, offering excellent connectivity and everyday convenience.

Convenience Nearby

Educational Institutions

  • Kallyanpur Girls School & College
  • Ambition International School
  • Sifat International School
  • Kallyanpur Preparatory & Junior High School
  • Art Academy Kallyanpur, Dhaka
  • Mirpur Bangla College

Healthcare Facilities

  • IBN SINA Medical College Hospital
  • BIHS General Hospital
  • Kallyan Manshik Hospital
  • Bangladesh Specialized Hospital
  • Dhaka Central International Medical College & Hospital (DCIMCH)
  • CKD & Urology Hospital
  • Dhaka Trauma Center & Specialized Orthopedic Hospital
  • Bangladesh Spine & Orthopedic Hospital Ltd.

Restaurants & Food Zones

  • KFC
  • BFC
  • Muslim Sweets
  • Khaja Hotel & Restaurant
  • Hazi Biriyani House
  • Premium Sweets
  • Prime Sweets
  • Kazi Kitchen
  • Chillis
  • Numerous cafés & coffee shops
  • Chinese & Bangla restaurants

Recreational Spots

  • Kallyanpur Sports Field
  • Shyamoli Sports Field
  • Kollol Kutir Resort & Picnic Spot

Super Shops

  • Prince Bazar
  • Agora
  • Shwapno

More About the Location

  • Government Children’s Hospital, National Heart Foundation, National Institute of Mental Health, Chandrima Udyan, and Prime Minister’s Office are all within a short driving distance.
  • Ideal choice if you are searching for a flat near Mirpur, Adabor, Mohammadpur, Gabtoli, Agargaon, Ring Road, Shekertek, Mirpur-2, Mirpur-10, Mirpur-11, Mirpur Stadium, Mirpur-12, or Shyamoli.

Features & Amenities

Electrical & Utilities

  • Concealed PVC conduit electrical wiring
  • Standard quality electrical fittings
  • Air-conditioner power point in master bedroom

Bathroom Features

  • Concealed water lines
  • Standard sanitary fittings with mirrors
  • Ceramic wall & floor tiles (RAK / Mir / Fu-Wang / CBC)
  • PVC bathroom doors

Kitchen Features

  • Wall tiles up to 7 feet height
  • Ceramic tiled flooring
  • Double burner gas outlet
  • Stainless steel sink with concrete shelves
  • Exhaust fan facility

General Facilities

  • Secured entrance with driveway
  • Covered car parking
  • Reception lobby & security post
  • Generator backup for lift & common areas
  • Intercom connection to guard room

Structural & Safety

  • RCC Moment Resisting Frame (MRF)
  • Earthquake resistant (BNBC Code)
  • High-quality cement & steel bars
  • Heat-protective roof treatment

Doors, Windows & Flooring

  • Imported main entrance door with safety lock
  • Sliding aluminum windows with tinted glass
  • Safety grills on all windows
  • Premium ceramic floor tiles

properties.content:

Bashundhara, a sought-after residential area, caters to families seeking a tranquil haven in the city. With well-planned infrastructure, top schools, leading universities, Jamuna Future Park, and Apollo Hospital, it offers a perfect blend of convenience and serenity.

Transportation:

• Seamless access to different parts of Dhaka without route changes.

properties.title: iNTECH MARIUM VILLA
properties.content:
Welcome to your dream home in the vibrant heart of Kuril in Dhaka! Presenting an exquisite residential apartment for sale in Kuril, developed by the renowned iNTECH PROPERTIES LTD. This ongoing project is a testament to luxury living, offering unparalleled comfort and convenience.

Property Features:

  1. Prime Location: Nestled in the sought-after neighborhood of Kuril, this property ensures easy access to essential amenities, schools, shopping centers, and entertainment hubs.
  2. Residential Bliss: Designed for modern living, this residential apartment embodies sophistication and comfort. The layout is thoughtfully crafted to maximize space utilization and provide a seamless flow between rooms.
  3. Ongoing Excellence: Invest in the future with this ongoing project by iNTECH PROPERTIES LTD. Be part of a community that values quality craftsmanship and attention to detail. Witness your dream home come to life.
  4. Developer's Legacy: iNTECH PROPERTIES LTD, a name synonymous with trust and innovation, brings you a home that reflects their commitment to excellence. With a proven track record, you can rest assured that your investment is in safe hands.

Whether you are a first-time homebuyer or seeking an upgrade, this flat for sale in Kuril promises a lifestyle that meets the highest standards. Seize the opportunity to own a slice of luxury in this thriving neighborhood. Act now, and make your dream home a reality!

blog_posts.title: Buying vs Renting: Find Your Best Home Choice!
blog_posts.content:
Buying vs Renting a Home: Which is the Best Choice for You ?

1. Introduction

The decision to buy or rent a home is one of the most significant financial choices you’ll make in your lifetime. The answer isn’t one-size-fits-all, and it can have lasting impacts on your personal and financial well-being. The key is understanding the full scope of both options. While buying a home often symbolizes stability and financial success, renting can provide flexibility and lower initial costs. So, how do you decide which option is best for you? Let’s explore the pros and cons of both paths in-depth.

2. Understanding the Difference Between Buying and Renting

Before jumping into the decision-making process, it’s essential to understand the fundamental differences between buying and renting.

  • Buying a Home means purchasing property, either by paying in full or through a mortgage loan. When you own a home, you build equity over time, which can be an important financial asset. You have full control over the property, meaning you can renovate and modify it as you see fit.
  • Renting a Home, on the other hand, involves signing a lease to live in a property for a set period, usually on a month-to-month or yearly basis. While you pay rent to live there, you do not own the property, and any modifications or major decisions regarding the home are made by the landlord.

3. Advantages of Buying a Home

Long-Term Investment Opportunity

Buying a home is often seen as a long-term investment. Real estate, over time, typically appreciates in value. According to data from the U.S. Federal Housing Finance Agency, home prices in the U.S. have increased at an average annual rate of 3.5% over the past 40 years. If you buy a home today, chances are it will be worth significantly more in the future, especially in high-demand areas.

Building Equity

Each mortgage payment you make contributes to building equity, which is the portion of the property you truly own. As you pay down your mortgage, your equity increases, and so does your financial stake in the property. When compared to renting, where monthly payments do not provide any return, this is one of the most compelling reasons to consider buying.

Stability and Security

Owning a home provides a sense of stability and permanence. You don’t have to worry about a landlord raising the rent or asking you to move. Additionally, you have full control over your living space, from painting walls to making larger renovations.

Tax Deductions and Benefits

Homeownership can come with significant tax benefits. In many countries, mortgage interest and property taxes are tax-deductible. For example, in the U.S., the average homeowner who itemizes deductions saves around $1,500 annually through mortgage interest deductions alone.

4. Disadvantages of Buying a Home

High Upfront Costs

The initial costs of buying a home can be a huge financial hurdle. Between a down payment (usually 10% to 20% of the home’s value), closing costs, and various fees, buyers often need to have significant savings before even considering a purchase.

For instance, if you are purchasing a home valued at $300,000, a 20% down payment would be $60,000, not including closing costs, which typically add 2-5% of the purchase price, resulting in an additional $6,000 to $15,000.

Responsibility for Maintenance and Repairs

When you own a home, all maintenance and repair costs fall squarely on your shoulders. On average, homeowners spend between 1-3% of their home’s value annually on repairs and upkeep. So, for a $300,000 home, expect to spend $3,000 to $9,000 per year on maintenance.

Less Flexibility

Owning a home ties you to a location. If your job requires frequent moves, or if you foresee significant life changes (like expanding your family), homeownership can limit your mobility. Selling a home can take months, and you may not always get the price you expect, especially if the housing market is unfavorable.

5. Advantages of Renting a Home

Flexibility and Mobility

Renting offers the freedom to move easily. Most lease agreements last for one year, after which you can decide to renew or relocate. This is ideal for those who are unsure of where they want to settle or anticipate moving for job opportunities.

Lower Financial Commitment Upfront

The upfront costs for renting are much lower than buying. Typically, renters need to pay the first month’s rent, a security deposit (usually one month's rent), and sometimes a fee for a credit check. This makes renting more accessible for those who haven’t accumulated enough savings for a down payment on a house.

Limited Responsibility for Repairs and Maintenance

One of the biggest advantages of renting is that landlords are typically responsible for major repairs and maintenance. If the roof leaks or the HVAC system breaks down, it’s the landlord’s job to fix it, saving renters thousands of dollars in repair costs.

6. Disadvantages of Renting a Home

No Equity or Ownership

When you rent, you’re essentially paying to live in someone else’s property without building any financial equity. Over the years, those rent payments add up with no return on investment. According to a 2023 survey, the average American spends approximately $16,800 on rent annually, which equates to $168,000 over 10 years with no financial benefit.

Rising Rental Costs

Rent is subject to change, and in high-demand areas, rent can rise significantly year over year. In some urban areas, rent increases have averaged 5-10% annually, making it harder to maintain a stable budget.

Less Control Over Your Living Situation

When renting, you’re limited by your lease agreement and the preferences of the landlord. If they decide to sell the property or renovate, you may be forced to move. Additionally, you can’t make major changes to the property without permission, limiting your ability to personalize your space.

7. Key Financial Considerations

When deciding between renting and buying, you must assess your financial situation. Key considerations include:

Upfront Costs

  • Buying: Down payment (10-20%), closing costs (2-5%), home inspection, and initial repairs.
  • Renting: First month's rent, security deposit, and possibly a broker’s fee.

Monthly Payments

  • Buying: Mortgage payments, property taxes, homeowners insurance, and maintenance.
  • Renting: Rent and possibly renters insurance.

Long-Term Costs

Over time, owning a home can be more cost-effective than renting due to equity building and appreciation. However, unexpected repairs and market fluctuations must be considered.

8. Current Housing Market Conditions

Today’s housing market fluctuates based on a range of factors, including interest rates, supply and demand, and economic conditions. Currently, with interest rates hovering around 7% for a 30-year fixed mortgage, borrowing has become more expensive. However, housing supply remains low in many areas, driving home prices higher.

Renting can also be affected by these market trends. In areas where housing is scarce, rental prices have been increasing sharply. It’s crucial to consider these market conditions when making a decision.

9. Lifestyle and Personal Goals

When deciding between renting and buying a home, your lifestyle and personal goals are crucial factors. If you thrive on flexibility and adventure—maybe you frequently relocate for work or prefer the freedom to explore different neighborhoods—renting may be your best option. This path allows you to experience various living situations without the long-term commitment that comes with homeownership. Conversely, if you envision settling down, starting a family, or investing in a stable future, buying a home could align better with your aspirations. Reflecting on your short-term and long-term goals will guide you toward the choice that suits your life plan.

10. Investment Comparison: Renting vs. Buying

Investing in a home is often seen as a pathway to wealth accumulation, given the historical appreciation of real estate values. Over time, home equity can grow significantly, serving as a financial safety net or a source of funds for future investments. On the other hand, renting allows for investment diversification. You can allocate funds that would go toward a mortgage into stocks, bonds, or other opportunities, potentially yielding higher returns. Understanding your risk tolerance and investment goals will help you weigh these options effectively.

11. Tax Implications for Homeowners vs. Renters

Tax benefits differ significantly between homeowners and renters. Homeowners can deduct mortgage interest and property taxes from their taxable income, providing substantial savings, especially in the early years of a mortgage when interest payments are high. Renters, however, have limited tax deductions, although some states offer tax credits for renters. Recognizing these implications can influence your financial strategy and long-term planning.

12. Psychological and Emotional Considerations

The emotional dimensions of renting versus buying shouldn't be overlooked. Homeownership can foster a sense of stability and pride, giving you complete control over your living space. In contrast, renting offers peace of mind from not worrying about maintenance and market fluctuations. Evaluating what makes you feel secure and fulfilled will guide you toward a decision that aligns with your emotional needs.

13. Renting as a Short-Term Solution

Renting can be an excellent short-term solution for various situations, such as job relocations, transitional phases, or when saving for a future purchase. It allows individuals to enjoy their current lifestyle without the responsibilities of homeownership. Moreover, renting can help you gauge what features you want in a future home, making it easier to find the right fit when you decide to buy.

14. Buying a Home as a Long-Term Commitment

Buying a home is often a long-term commitment, requiring thorough preparation and financial assessment. It’s essential to evaluate your job stability, family plans, and lifestyle preferences before making this significant investment. A well-considered approach includes budgeting for ongoing costs like maintenance, insurance, and property taxes, ensuring that you are ready for the responsibilities that homeownership entails.

15. Conclusion: Which Is Right for You?

Ultimately, the decision to rent or buy hinges on your individual circumstances, financial situation, and future aspirations. While renting offers flexibility and lower upfront costs, buying a home can lead to financial security and equity growth over time. Assessing your lifestyle, financial readiness, and personal goals will provide the clarity needed to make the right choice for your situation.

FAQs

  1. What are the financial risks of buying a home?
    Unexpected repairs, property devaluation, and fluctuating market conditions.
  2. Is renting or buying more cost-effective?
    It depends on market conditions, location, and your financial health.
  3. How long should I rent before buying?
    Until you’re financially stable and ready for a long-term commitment.
  4. How does a credit score impact buying a home?
    A higher credit score can secure better mortgage rates and terms.
  5. Can I invest in real estate without buying a home?
    Yes, through Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) and other investment options.

meta.rank_math_description: Wondering whether to buy or rent? Explore the pros and cons to discover the best choice for your lifestyle and budget!

blog_posts.title: What Is SEO? Learn How Google Ranks Websites Easily
blog_posts.content:
Introduction to SEO

If you've ever wondered how websites show up on Google when you search for something, the answer is SEO—short for Search Engine Optimization. It's the magic (not really magic, but more like strategy and effort) behind every top-ranking website.

What Does SEO Stand For?

SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization, and it’s all about improving your website’s visibility in search engines like Google. The better your SEO, the higher your website ranks, and the more people find you online.

Why Is SEO Important?

Let’s keep it real—if your site doesn’t show up on page one of Google, it’s basically invisible. SEO helps you get seen, grow your audience, and ultimately convert visitors into customers. Plus, organic traffic is free!

How Search Engines Work

Search engines like Google use bots to crawl the internet, index content, and then rank pages based on what they think users want to see. It's like a giant librarian organizing every page of the web.

The Basics of Google Ranking

Crawling, Indexing, and Ranking

First, Google crawls your site with bots. Then, it indexes your pages—kind of like filing them in its digital library. Finally, it ranks them based on relevance, speed, usability, and hundreds of other factors.

Google’s Algorithm Explained Simply

Google’s algorithm is a constantly changing recipe. It considers content quality, page load speed, mobile-friendliness, backlinks, and more to decide where your page shows up.

What Affects Search Rankings?

  • Content quality
  • Keyword usage
  • Page speed
  • Mobile usability
  • Backlinks
  • Site structure
  • User engagement (bounce rate, time on site)

Types of SEO

On-Page SEO

This is everything you control on your own site.

Keyword Optimization

Choose the right keywords and sprinkle them naturally throughout your content. Don’t overdo it though!

Title Tags and Meta Descriptions

These are the first things users see on Google. Make them catchy, clear, and include your keyword.

Content Structure and Internal Linking

Use headers (H1, H2, H3) and link to other pages on your site to help users (and Google) navigate easily.

Off-Page SEO

This is what happens off your website.

Backlinks and Authority

When other sites link to yours, Google sees that as a vote of confidence.

Social Signals and Brand Mentions

Social shares and online buzz can influence your credibility, indirectly helping your rankings.

Technical SEO

This is the behind-the-scenes stuff.

Site Speed and Mobile-Friendliness

If your site is slow or clunky on mobile, users bounce—and Google notices.

XML Sitemaps and Robots.txt

These help Google crawl your site more effectively.

Keyword Research and Strategy

How to Find the Right Keywords

Use tools like Google Keyword Planner, Ubersuggest, or Ahrefs to find terms your audience is searching for.

Long-Tail vs. Short-Tail Keywords

  • Short-tail: “Shoes” (broad, competitive)
  • Long-tail: “Best running shoes for flat feet” (specific, easier to rank)

Keyword Tools You Can Use

  • Google Keyword Planner
  • SEMrush
  • Ahrefs
  • Ubersuggest
  • Answer the Public

SEO Content Creation

Writing for Users and Search Engines

Balance is key. Write content people love reading, and optimize it so search engines can find it.

Optimizing Blog Posts and Pages

Use headings, bullet points, keywords, internal links, images with alt tags, and clear formatting.

Avoiding Keyword Stuffing

Google hates unnatural keyword use. Always focus on the reader first.

Understanding Backlinks

What Are Backlinks and Why They Matter

Backlinks are links from other websites to yours. The more quality backlinks you have, the more trustworthy Google thinks your site is.

How to Build High-Quality Links

  • Guest blogging
  • Reaching out for mentions
  • Creating shareable content
  • Building relationships in your niche

Link-Building Mistakes to Avoid

  • Buying links
  • Spammy directory submissions
  • Irrelevant backlinks

User Experience and SEO

Bounce Rate and Dwell Time

Google watches how users interact with your site. If they leave too quickly, that’s a red flag.

Core Web Vitals

These are performance metrics Google uses—like loading speed, interactivity, and visual stability.

Mobile-First Indexing

Google now ranks the mobile version of your site first, so make sure it looks great on phones.

SEO Tools to Make Your Life Easier

Google Search Console

See how your site performs in search, fix indexing issues, and monitor keywords.

Google Analytics

Track traffic sources, behavior, conversion rates, and more.

Other Helpful SEO Tools

  • Yoast SEO (for WordPress)
  • Screaming Frog
  • Moz
  • SEMrush

Common SEO Myths

“SEO Is Dead”

Nope. As long as people use search engines, SEO is alive and well.

“More Keywords = Better Ranking”

More isn’t better. Better is better.

“You Only Need SEO Once”

SEO is an ongoing process, not a one-time fix.

How Long Does SEO Take to Work?

Short-Term vs. Long-Term Results

Some changes (like fixing a broken link) can help quickly. Others (like building authority) take months.

Factors That Impact Timing

  • Competition
  • Content quality
  • Website history
  • Link profile

Local SEO

What Is Local SEO?

If you’re a local business, you want to show up when people search “near me.” That’s what Local SEO does.

Optimizing for Google Maps and Local Listings

  • Claim your Google Business Profile
  • Get local reviews
  • Use local keywords

SEO vs. Paid Ads

Organic vs. Paid Traffic

SEO gets you free, long-term traffic. Paid ads give you immediate results, but cost money.

When to Use SEO and When to Use PPC

Use SEO for sustainable growth. Use PPC for short-term campaigns, testing offers, or quick visibility.

How to Stay Updated with SEO

Algorithm Updates

Google rolls out updates regularly. Stay informed so your site doesn’t drop in rankings overnight.

Following Google’s Webmaster Guidelines

These are the rules of the SEO game. Break them, and you could get penalized.

Hiring an SEO Expert vs. Doing It Yourself

Pros and Cons of DIY SEO

DIY SEO saves money but takes time and learning.

When to Hire a Professional

If you run a business and don’t have time to learn SEO, hiring a pro is worth the investment.

Conclusion

SEO isn’t just a buzzword—it’s the key to unlocking online visibility. Whether you’re a blogger, business owner, or digital marketer, understanding how Google ranks websites gives you a massive edge. Focus on quality content, user experience, and consistent effort, and you’ll start seeing your pages climb the ranks.

FAQs

1. What is the main purpose of SEO?
To improve your website’s visibility on search engines and attract more organic (unpaid) traffic.

2. How does Google decide which site to rank first?
It uses a complex algorithm that considers content quality, relevance, site speed, backlinks, and many other factors.

3. Is SEO better than paid ads?
SEO offers long-term, cost-effective traffic. Paid ads give fast results but require ongoing spending.

4. Can I do SEO on my own?
Yes! With the right tools and learning, anyone can start optimizing their site for search engines.

5. How often should I update my SEO strategy?
Regularly. SEO is an ongoing process—monitor your results, follow Google updates, and adapt as needed.

blog_posts.title: iNTECH PROPERTIES LTD received 'Inma Global Award' along with PROTHOM ALO
blog_posts.content:
Honorary Managing Director of Intech Properties Limited, while receiving an award with Prothom Alo at a function of the daily Prothom Alo

"The International News Media Association (INMA) has recently given 'Inma Global Award' to Dainik Prothom Alo for its successful completion of the online housing fair (November-21) organized by Dainik Prothom Alo. My favorite iNTECH Properties LTD also participated in the housing fair. So Prothom Alo thanked us and said that we are also partners in this achievement.
Greetings from iNTECH Properties Limited for honoring us with one of the largest media in the country today.


Over the past decade, the number of young people in business has been growing at a positive rate. The main reason for this is that young people are now trying to use their thoughts properly. Another major reason is the spread of the Internet and technology. And because of that, people can easily spread their thoughts and activities all over the world. That is why many young entrepreneurs are being created now.
They have shown time and time again that success is not something that can be achieved if they use their methods at the right time and in the right way.


In other words, they are setting a shining example for young people to use their time wisely. It also proves that age is not a factor in becoming an entrepreneur. All you need is a good plan, a far-reaching thought, an idea and a strong attitude.
So start with self-confidence and good initiatives, and success will come.

blog_posts.title: From 50 flats hand over occasion
blog_posts.content:
Alhamdulillah, iNTECH has handed over 50 flats to the customers.
iNTECH Properties Ltd., one of the leading real estate businesses in the country, has handed over 50 flats to the customers of iNTECH Amin Garden and iNTECH Bidhilipi in Darussalam and Kalyanpur, the heart of the capital.

Mr. Ashraf Uddin, Chairman, iNTECH Properties Ltd., Mr. Ashraf Uddin, Managing Director, Mr. Ashraf Uddin, Managing Director, Mr. Ashraf Uddin, Managing Director, iNTECH Properties Ltd., Mr. Ashraf Uddin Bhoona.

Excerpts from the speech of the Honorable Managing Director of the company M Fakhrul Islam

"Honorable Attendance Many of you know that iNTECH Properties Ltd. was established in 2012 and started the project in January 2013 with a working capital of only Rs. Today, in a very short span of time, iNTECH Properties Ltd. has transformed Al Hamdulillah into one of the most reputed companies in the country. Mr. Alhaj Md. Ashraf Uddin, Hon'ble Chairman of iNTECH Properties Ltd., Vice President of iNTECH Properties Ltd. Chairman Mr. Md. Nasir Uddin and Director Planning Engineer Shah Alam Bhuiyan. And being the youngest, I have formed a working management system with all business, social, political and overall issues in mind. Honorable Mr. Alhaj Enamul Haque Saheb, Honorable President and Distinguished Social Worker of Greater Kalyanpur Samaj Kalyan Parishad of iNTECH Saleha Kunj Project is one of the selfless collaborators in establishing iNTECH Properties Ltd. today. I respectfully remember Uddin Bhuiyan today. I am grateful to all of you who have donated your valuable land and all the customers who have invested their hard earned money. It would have been more difficult for us to walk without your sincere love, unlimited trust, cooperation and investment.

iNTECH Properties Ltd: Today you have been able to create huge employment opportunities only because of your confidence and investment. On behalf of all the management of our company, I would like to express my respect and gratitude to you again. Today you will be happy to know that your favorite intake has undertaken huge and massive projects in different prime locations of Dhaka. With your prayers, love and the grace of the great Lord, iNTECH will be able to implement the project worth about 100 crore taka inshallah. Housing is a basic human right, and iNTECH is working on that important right. In the same way that I have been able to ensure at least one accommodation for you, I am expressing my hope that we can transform this industry related to the people into one of the leading institutions in the country. “

Finally he said more
“Our esteemed customer is Erong Landowner
The most important guest in our yard

He is not dependent on us at all
Rather we depend on him

He never interferes with our work
Rather, he is the occasion for our work

He is not an outsider in our business
Rather, all our activities are for him


Rather, all our activities are for him

We are not doing him a favor by providing services
Rather, he is the one with the opportunity to serve
He has blessed us. ”

Therefore, we are informing the new flat recipients through our vast intake family

“Your small savings are your country
Moving the economy forward, and with those small savings
When you build a permanent address for future generations ……
So before booking elsewhere
I invite you to visit our project. ”

Among others who were present on the occasion were Mr. Al Haj Mohammad Ruhul Amin, eminent industrialist of iNTECH Amin Garden, Mrs. Nasim Sultana, Land Owner of iNTECH Ordinance Project and all the flat buyers.
It was attended by project related suppliers and contractors.
The ceremony was followed by a dinner.

blog_posts.title: Recent Article By Banglar Abashon About iNTECH’S Managing Director
blog_posts.content:
M. Fakhrul Islam, successful real estate entrepreneur. He is the Managing Director of iNTECH Properties Limited, a real estate company established in the country. He and his iNTECH properties have been working with a reputation for a long time in the real estate industry. He is also associated with a number of social service organizations. For those who are involved in the real estate industry, for those who are interested in joining the new industry. Fakhrul Islam is undoubtedly a great inspiration.

Career Story:

At the end of his studies, He started working in the organization, but at one point the organization closed down. A lot of pressure on the head then. Since acquaintances came here through him. His first test was to be able to explain everything to them correctly. He did it successfully, it increased his reputation in the familiar circle.

Once the family decided to send him abroad, He did not agree at all. In such a situation He came to Dhaka in search of something new. Having great experience in real estate in his previous job, He started thinking about this sector. He found four acquaintances by his side in his new journey. Among them were Gias Uddin Bhoona, the then Shyamoli Branch Manager of NCC Bank Limited, Enamul Haque, General Secretary of Greater Kalyanpur Social Welfare Council, Ashraf Uddin and Nasir Uddin, cousins.

As soon as they started the work of iNTECH Properties, it quickly became popular in Kalyanpur and ensured housing facilities to the people in the fastest time. The same year He started another housing company called Rahbar, now He am the managing director of both companies. In 2012, they started another company called 'Altrade' to supply garments. You can say, the success of iNTECH attracts people to his various activities. Through which it is very well known in several big organizations including rehab today.

Notable projects:

  1. iNTECH Amin Garden
  2. iNTECH Saleha Kunj
  3. iNTECH Shopnochaya
  4. iNTECH Uttoron-1
  5. iNTECH Raisa
  6. iNTECH Pushpita
  7. iNTECH Shopnochura
  8. iNTECH MARIYUM

iNTECH Tips for those new to the sector:

The behavior of this sector is that you have to adapt to the world. In 2022, you have to have that mentality in the settlement area where the people of the world want better opportunities. Newcomers must have the ability to lead. Because if the new organization works well, people's confidence will increase. Those who work in this sector mean that the coordination between civil engineers, project in-charges, suppliers of different raw materials is also a kind of challenge in this business. If everything is regular, there is no reason not to do well in this sector.

For young people: We get CV through job portals of the country. Our admin department works with it. As the project grows, so does our workload. Manpower also increases. So request to newcomers, stay updated all the time; Where there is no opportunity. Institutions look at whether we have the skills we want. People who know the basics of work are needed first. I myself first learned to work in this sector without pay, which laid the foundation for me. Retirement: There is enough load in this sector to get leisure time. However, when he has so much time, he loves to spend time with family, social service organizations, colleagues and childhood friends. Fakhrul Islam. It has its weaknesses towards different brands of cars. The list of hobbies also includes watches and perfumes of different brands.

blog_posts.title: NATIONAL TIMES INTERVIEW “ M FAKHRUL ISLAM a true inspiration for the youth”
blog_posts.content:
We have been working for a long time to meet the housing needs of the middle class

M Fakhrul Islam Managing Director iNTECH PROPERTIES LTD, Young icon personality of Bangladesh housing sector. He is also a young social worker. Outspoken M Fakhrul Islam is a popular face of the media and he regularly participates in various talk shows such as ATN Bangla, ATN News, Banglavision, Ekattar TV, MyTV, popular print media like prothom alo etc. He served as a member of the Standing Committee on Promotion of Rehab. Served as one of the standing committee members of the Construction Industry Skills Council (CISC) under the Prime Minister’s Office. Been doing it for a long time. Highly talented, modest M Fakhrul Islam is the trusted young entrepreneur of today.

Bangladesh's trade and business industrialization smart young executive M. Fakhrul Islam is one of them. Those who think not only about themselves, but also about their organization, sect and so on

Above all about the country. This talented, enlightened, visionary, creative, modern and science-minded successful housing business personality M. Fakhrul Islam is the managing director of iNTECH PROPERTIES LTD and Rahabar, one of the private sector housing companies of the country. iNTECH PROPERTIES LTD has been able to reach an enviable level in the country's housing industry today with its own talent, hard work, and perseverance. Confident M. From childhood, Fakhrul Islam dreamed of establishing himself as well as how to establish a just society by working for the welfare of the people of the country.

After completing his education, he started his professional life by taking a job as a field officer of Far East Islami Insurance Company Ltd. in his native Sonagazi Upazila. Seeing the work performance of this talented young woman, thousands of people were unemployed in the country around 2006-2007.

An organization called Tarun Shapphanga Yuva Employment Society (YUBAK) offered him to work as a group in-charge. M Fakhrul Islam agreed to their proposal and worked there, he was elected as the highest organizer in the 'Youth' organization and was awarded as the best organizer in a youth gathering at Feni Zahir Raihan Hall auditorium in a gathering of about 5 thousand young women. However, due to legal complications, when the legality of 'Yuvak' was questioned, the organization was transformed into a company. But M. Fakhrul Islam has succeeded in passing all his responsibilities. At one stage he decided on the job.

No, engage yourself in business and social activities. And so he considered the business as a social service and established the housing industry company 'iNTECH PROPERTIES LTD’ and Rahbar. Mr. M. Fakhrul Islam thinks that the purpose of doing business is to make oneself financially independent as well as to serve people. The bigger the business establishment, the more employment opportunities are created.

So he is not content with providing employment to a few people through his small housing industry firm iNTECH PROPERTIES LTD; He always wants to selflessly engage himself in self-reliance as a businessman.

Fakhrul Islam is leading by being involved with various commercial and social organizations in addition to business. He is an honorary member of Real Estate and Housing Association of Bangladesh Rehab, a commercial organization of the housing industry. This person has been thinking since childhood. What is the way to serve people? How to work for the development of society and state. This tendency greatly motivates him. So he involved himself with various social and voluntary organizations from his student days and he participated in social development work from his native village. M. Fakhrul Islam established the Londonipara Islamic Library in Sonagazi in 2006 with the young society and students of his area. The only purpose of which was that the helpless, poor and talented students of the area could learn. Currently this The library is also providing free books and educational materials to the needy poor talented students of the area. M. Fakhrul Islam did not stop here. He developed a project called Nashir Uddin Sech and Scheme (Irrigation) Project with the local farmers to get back their rightful rights for the development of the country's agriculture and the development of the farmers, and through this project, in 2007, about 150,000 hectares of land in Sonagazi Upazila was brought under cultivation to hundreds of thousands of farmers in the area helped to smile.

He also built M. Hashim Foundation the service of humanity. Social organizations like A Hasem Foundation, Khidmah Trust and Sonagazi Multipurpose Cooperative Society. From all these organizations, helping and supporting the helpless poor people who are deprived of the benefits of the society and distributing free educational materials to the poor and talented students, participate in social and cultural activities. M. as a student. Fakhrul Islam has wide recognition and reputation, he is the founder president of Nashir Uddin Government Primary School of Sonagazi Upazila and is associated with various educational, social and cultural organizations are involved. In recognition of the work M. Fakhrul Islam was awarded numerous awards from various organizations. In true sense he is an honest, ideal, philanthropic and sincere friend of hardworking people. Also a successful partner in socio-economic development of the country. Mr. M. Fakhrul Islam is progressing from the small scale of life to the big yard of success with the best combination of hard work, diligence, honesty, discipline, visionary thinking and talent, above all by the infinite grace of Allah.

Meritorious person M. Fakhrul Islam was born on 1 January 1984 in Charchandia (now Londoni Para) village of Samudrasnat Sonagazi upazila in a noble Muslim family. Father: Abdul Halim. Mother Saleha Begum. M. among nine brothers and sisters. Fakhrul Islam is the eighth and the youngest among the brothers, so he grew up with a lot of care. He spent his childhood days listening to the gentle breeze of nature and the sound of the sea in his native Charchandia Upazila. Grandfather Hafez Abdur Rashid was never found, but he was brought up with enough care by grandmother Bibi Maryam. Since childhood M Fakhrul Islam was very calmly of nature.

They were still pioneers in sports and cultural practices even during their time. Fakhrul Islam started his education at the age of 5. He passed Dakhil with merit from Ulama Mazar Madrasah in 2001. Alim, Fazil and Kamil passed Takmil (Masters Honors Arabic) in 2006 from the same madrasa. Later, he obtained a bachelor's degree in Arabic literature from Chittagong Darul-Ma Arif Islami University. Mr. M. Fakhrul Islam achieved first place in every class in his education life. Managing Director of Intake Properties Limited, successful entrepreneur and housing industry M. Fakhrul Islam recently gave a meaningful interview on the various problems and prospects of the housing industry.

National Times:

One of the basic needs of people is the housing industry, although it is a mature industry, there are still many problems here. What is your opinion on this?

M. Fakhrul Islam:

I would say that the condition of the housing industry in Bangladesh is good in the current context, for those who maintain quality from the beginning of the business in this industry and deliver flats/apartments within a specified time as promised to the buyer. But the sales are a little less, but I think the reason behind this is that people's trust in developers is decreasing day by day. In the recent times some of the developer companies have come into the real estate sector and have not handed over the flats/apartments as promised, taking money from even the respectable buyers. I will tell you that by passing the time by making various kinds of arguments, they have been turning the customers around for years, and even some companies have lost their money. I think that if even one buyer out of 10 buyers is harassed, then that one buyer discloses the matter to at least 20 other buyers, thereby placing the blame on the entire developer. In other words, the responsibility of the bad name is falling on the entire sector. In this way, the real estate sector is having some negative impact as the common buyers have lost confidence in the developers as well. Not only that, because of this lack of confidence, many of our expatriate Bengalis, who used to invest in the housing sector, have no shortage of investment. Reduced the amount significantly. Which is why investing in this sector some issues.

In this case, I think it is possible to overcome the recession in the housing sector if rehab takes effective steps with the help of the government to gain the confidence of the buyers. I believe that maintaining the quality of the flats/apartments and handing over the flats/apartments within the specified time as promised to the buyers will also bring confidence to the buyers in this sector. The number of buyers will increase and the evils of this industry will be removed to a large extent. M. Fakhrul Islam: Look, infrastructural development including gas-electricity and utility connections around the housing industry plays a very important role in the execution and sale of all types of projects. Judging from that, we are keeping our commitment with Crotas by trying our best to complete the projects of iNTECH PROPERTIES LTD within the specified time. But many of us are unable to complete many projects due to various problems. As an entrepreneur, it has become a major hindrance in expanding our business operations. Therefore, despite the demand of the common buyers, it is not possible for us to meet it. But I can say with certainty that our sincerity in this matter is not

National Times:

In the field of industrial establishment bank investment is significant. Deregulation and high interest rates have reduced credit flows. Industrialization is causing a negative reaction for good reasons. Offer your own opinion on this matter?

M Fakhrul Islam:

Yes, I agree that investment is a big factor in setting up an industry. Which is currently being felt by the owners of the housing industry. But almost every bank in the country is quite generous for genuine businessmen and industrial entrepreneurs. Nowadays most of the banks are making big investments through syndication. Getting investment in setting up industries is no longer a problem. If the banks of our country give the interest rate as our neighboring countries are charging, the flow of credit will increase to a great extent. It will establish extensive industrial establishments in the country.

National Times:

What are the main problems in the development of the housing industry? Are you hoping for a solution?

M. Fakhrul Islam:

Increase in registration fee, long delay in design approval Rajuk, long waiting time to get gas, electricity and utility connection due to which many times it is not possible to hand over flats/apartments to customers within specified time. We still have to go to at least 10 places to collect various documents and simplify them. I am only listening to the words of hope. The concerned department of the government to identify the issues and take effective measures. In this case, the leaders of Rihas should be more active. As a member of Rehab it is our lifeblood.

National Times:

What is your procedure for selling flat/apartment?

M Fakhrul Islam:

You will be happy to know that we have an artistic mass marketing approach to sales. The manner in which our organization is connected with flat construction, marketing and sales activities. Our people who work here are a bunch of highly educated and smart executives. They connect the 4 'P's' of marketing (Product Place, Price, Promotion) with one more 'P' (People) to get deep into the minds of potential buyers

Our esteemed marketing executives have painted Vijay Tilak in the company's financial prosperity by achieving sales by connecting with the customer. Our Marketing Executives understand the language of the human mind and become courteous in their hospitality.

becoming the customer's own, like a member of the same family. They are trusted by people because of their presentation and are trusted by buyers because of the reputation of our Intake Properties Ltd. and Rahbar Company. Thus the customers rely on the reputation of the company. Thus a marketing executive known to us as iNTECH PROPERTIES LTD and Rahbar Company becomes a favorite of a family and wins their hearts and is able to sell a flat/apartment. Which is really an industry friendly mass marketing method for our organization. This is how we have been selling our flats/apartments. Inshallah we are in a good position in terms of sales. Basically: The success and beauty of a real estate company is entirely dependent on marketing. To maintain this success, we have been ensuring the quality of our constructed flats/apartments 100% and completing the project handover and registration within the announced time. So I strongly believe, our esteemed customers are the only thing that can sustain us developer companies in the market. And the behind and visible controller is our mass marketing method.

National Times:

Bangladesh is at risk of the second earthquake in the world. In this matter how iNTECH PROPERTIES LTD tackle this situation?

M. Fakhrul Islam:

By the grace of Allah, there will not be any major earthquake during this period. We are constructing the building according to the National Building Code. Our buildings can withstand an earthquake of magnitude 8.0 on the Richter scale.

National Times:

How optimistic are you about the future of Bangladesh?

M Fakhrul Islam:

To be honest; I am an optimist myself. Love to dream love to hope too. Bangladesh will overcome all problems and become a developed country one day. The country's general flat purchase decision making index. They will increase the income of the people, higher in the nobility and knowledge of the way of life, but the standard of modesty will increase, there will be no instability and social terror, respectful and loyal to the political elite. People are his own. Invariably a respectable person will have security of life and money.

blog_posts.title: Types Of Home Loans in Bangladesh and how to get a home loan to buy a property
blog_posts.content:
5 Type of Home Loans in Bangladesh

Are you thinking to buy a property and worrying about how to get home loans in Bangladesh? You do not need to worry. Because there are a lot of financial institutions that are providing many exciting home loans. In your real estate journey buying or selling a property is a very significant part of your life. Whether you want to buy land, an apartment or an entire building, buying a property in Dhaka needs a strong financial background. And for this financing, you may need a home loan where banks and financial institutions may help to ease your property buying process.

In today's blog, we will introduce you to the types of Home loans in Bangladesh and how you can apply for a home loan to buy your dream property. After reading the whole article you will learn about

  • What is a home loan?
  • Different types of home loans in Bangladesh.
  • List of home loans provider in Bangladesh
  • Conditions to apply for a home loan.
  • Little information about BHBFC (Bangladesh House Building Finance Corporation).
  • Documents required to get home loans in Bangladesh.
  • Advantages of Property loans in Bangladesh.
  • Disadvantages of House loans in Bangladesh.

However, not everyone who wants to take out a mortgage is unable to raise the necessary funds. Those who are able to finance themselves are also at ease taking out a home loan in Bangladesh. Because making affordable monthly loan payments is much simpler than spending a sizable sum all at once.

What is a home loan?

A home loan, commonly referred to as a mortgage or housing loan, is a sum of money that a person borrows, typically from banks and other financial institutions. Depending on the loan's terms, the applicant will repay the loan balance plus interest over a period of time that can range from 10 to 30 years in Easy Monthly Instalments, or EMIs.

Only the elite and middle classes in Bangladesh were formerly covered by this type of mortgage. However, several financial institutions in Bangladesh are now providing home loans from farmers to the upper classes at straightforward interest rates, circumventing this restriction.

List of home loans provider in Bangladesh

Top banks and financial institutions who are providing home loans in bd.

SEE LIST OF HOME LOAN PROVIDER BANKS IN BD

Types of home loans in Bangladesh

Different home loans are now being given in Bangladesh by a variety of loan provider institutions. The housing market in Bangladesh is expanding because of these home financing programs. The top 5 home loan types in Bangladesh are listed below.

  1. Land Purchase Loan
  2. Home Purchase Loan
  3. Home Construction Loan
  4. Home Extension Loan
  5. Home Improvement Loan

Now let's discuss in detail these property loans in Bangladesh

Land Purchase Loan

A land purchase loan is a type of loan agreement where a loan is provided for the purchase of land. This kind of home loan is provided by the majority of banks or non-banking financial institutions (NBFIs) in Bangladesh.

These are a few aspects of this loan scheme:

  • You may be eligible for this loan up to 70–75% of the total land value, depending on the lending institution.
  • The maximum loan term is 12 years, while some loan programs provide longer terms.
  • Each institution sets its own interest rate for this loan.
  • Since property prices are always rising, it is very simple and simple to obtain land purchase credit facilities.

Home Purchase Loan

The most cost-effective option for financing the purchase of a new or used home is a home purchase loan. In Bangladesh, regardless of whether the home is new or old, the home loan is the most widely used type of loan. Features of Home Purchase Loan are-

  • All major banks and financial institutions (NBFIs) in Bangladesh offer home loans in various variants.
  • Home purchase loans account for 70-85% of the total cost of buying a home.
  • The tenure of this loan is from 1-25 years.
  • The interest rate of this loan also varies from institution to institution. However, the current interest rate in almost all institutions in Bangladesh is 9-14%.

Home construction loan

A home construction loan is a loan that a customer takes out to finance the building of the home of his choice without first purchasing a pre-built home.A home construction loan is a loan that a customer takes out to finance the building of the home of his choice without first purchasing a pre-built home. Features of Home Construction Loan are-

  • Consumers can use this loan to construct the home of their choice.
  • Home construction loans lend up to 80% of the total cost. Tax exemption can also be claimed on this loan.
  • Government employees will be able to take loans from any of the four state-owned banks and Bangladesh House Building Finance Corporation at 4% interest from April 2020. Because, here 5% to 9% interest is paid by the government.

Home extension loan

The loan accepted is known as a home extension loan if the customer wishes to expand his home, i.e., add a new floor, room, bathroom, kitchen, balcony, etc. to the property.

  • A few banks provide this type of loan.
  • In this loan, up to 70-80% of the total cost is available as a loan.
  • The maximum loan term is 25 years. Consequently, you can choose the lowest EMI possible.
  • You have a wide range of interest rate choices.
  • Interest rates come in three varieties: totally variable, semi-fixed, and fully fixed.

Home improvement loan

A home improvement loan is a loan taken for interior renovations including up-gradation of electrical appliances, painting, water-proofing, electrical wiring, ceiling and tile repairs to give the home a new look.

The tenure of this loan is much shorter than other home loans. Besides, the interest rate of these loans may vary based on the financial institution.

Chat with us if you have any questions.

Chat on WhatsApp

Conditions to apply for a home loan in Bangladesh

Many people purchase land or apartments with loans because, despite having the means, they lack the necessary capacity. However, even if you ask, banks and other financial institutions won't grant you a loan. Apply to the lending organizations by following some guidelines. You will receive the loan if you are determined to be eligible by the institutions.

  • Interest Rate: Before making a loan, every financial institution considers its interest. because the business's income comes from interest. Interest rates differ between institutions. The Bangladeshi government has set a fixed interest rate of 9% for borrowers in 2020, though this rate may be lower in some institutions.
  • Property Novelty: The date of the property's registration is typically used by banks to estimate the age of the property. Major banks in Bangladesh are often more eager to offer mortgage loans for the acquisition of recently built real estate properties than for older buildings. According to the report, residences that are under 20 years old have a better chance of qualifying for a mortgage. However, a number of banks, such as EBL and Bank Asia, are fairly lenient when it comes to offering house loan facilities for buying older properties.
  • Monthly Income: The monthly income has an impact on the customer's ability to repay the loan. Because of this, while granting house loans, banking institutions inquire about the customer's monthly income. The financial institutions provide loans if the yearly income of traders is BDT 200000 and the monthly compensation of employees is at least BDT 40000. However, restrictions on revenue may differ from one institution to another.
  • Death Burden Ratio: Comparing a potential customer's monthly gross income to their ability to repay a loan. DBR value is calculated using monthly income. Financial organizations are reluctant to grant the loan if the DBR value is more than the income.
  • Age Limit: The maximum loan term is between 25 and 30 years. This suggests that the loan is for a considerable amount of time. Age restrictions are specifically in place for several types of house loans in Bangladesh for this reason. The loan is declined if the borrower is too old to repay the debt in full (over 65). An institution may have a higher or lower age restriction.
  • Occupation of Borrower: A house loan's eligibility in Bangladesh is heavily influenced by employment. Obtaining a house loan will be lot simpler if one holds a reputable position in a reputable company in Bangladesh.
  • Having more than one earning person in the family: The possibility of being able to repay the loan within the specified time period is predicted by the number of wage earners in the family. If the loan application states that there are several earners, there is a good chance that the loan will be approved.

Documents required to get home loans in Bangladesh.

Documents required for taking a loan Building your own house is not a dream. Nowadays you can take loans for everything from building a house to buying land. But it is like you have to submit some necessary documents to the bank. Let's see what documents are required for taking a property loan in Bangladesh

  1. Photocopy of Voter ID Card. or driving license.
  2. Two copies of passport-size color photograph
  3. Trade license of business establishment (for businessmen).
  4. Attestation letter from office (for employees).
  5. National Identity Card and Photograph of Grantee.
  6. One month electricity bill paper.
  7. Bank statement for last six months.
  8. Required documents if have credit card.

Advantages of Property loans in Bangladesh

  • Fewer documentation is needed because there aren't many consumers for house loans.
  • If the loan is repaid on time, the borrower's social standing would rise along with their CIBIL Score, according to Credit Information Bureau (India) Limited.

Disadvantages of House loans in Bangladesh

  • The financing scheme must be used since the mortgage is long-term, lasting longer than 25 years.
  • There is no going back once the home loan application is authorized.
  • Your assets will be sold by the lender if you default on the loan so they may recover their losses.

The Bottom Line

With this comprehensive understanding of the many types of home loans in Bangladesh, you may make an informed choice on the loan that best suits your requirements. For the majority of individuals, getting a loan is the go-to method of financing whether they are purchasing, building, remodeling, or extending a property. Additionally, you must meet the significant requirements outlined by the banks and NBFIs in order to be eligible for these loans. Please leave a message if you have any other information on house loans.

Chat with us if you have any questions.

Chat on WhatsApp

Please note:

  • This information should not be considered legal advice. Consult with a lawyer before proceeding with a loan

blog_posts.title: New Infrastructure Projects and Government Efforts to Provide Affordable Housing Drive Dhaka's Property Market
blog_posts.content:
Dhaka, the capital city of Bangladesh, is rapidly developing and the property market is no exception. The city's development projects, such as the metro rail, expressway, and new airport extension, are driving the demand for residential and commercial properties in the city.

The property market in Dhaka is currently experiencing a period of growth, with an increasing number of people looking to invest in the city. The city's growing population, combined with the development of new infrastructure projects, has led to an increase in demand for both residential and commercial properties.

The metro rail project, for example, is expected to connect the city's major areas and make it easier for people to travel, which will in turn lead to an increase in property prices in the areas surrounding metro stations. Similarly, the new airport extension project is also expected to drive property prices in the areas surrounding the airport.

The expressway project, which connects the city's major areas, is also expected to have a positive impact on the property market. The expressway is expected to reduce traffic congestion and make it easier for people to travel, which will in turn lead to an increase in property prices in the areas surrounding the expressway.

In addition to these development projects, the government's focus on affordable housing is also expected to drive the property market in Dhaka. The government's efforts to provide affordable housing for the city's growing population will lead to an increase in demand for residential properties, which in turn will drive property prices.

Overall, the property market in Dhaka is expected to continue to grow in the future, driven by the city's development projects and the government's focus on affordable housing. Investors looking for high-yield investments and capital appreciation should consider investing in the property market in Dhaka. With a growing population and increasing demand for properties, the market is expected to remain strong for many years to come.

In conclusion, the property market in Dhaka is experiencing a growth, driven by the city's development projects and the government's focus on affordable housing. The metro rail, expressway, and new airport extension projects are expected to have a positive impact on the property market, making the area a perfect opportunity for property investment. The market is expected to remain strong for many years to come, providing a great chance for investors to make high-yield investments and capital appreciation.

blog_posts.title: কোন বয়স থেকে সঞ্চয় ও বিনিয়োগ শুরু করবেন?
blog_posts.content:
কোন বয়সে সঞ্চয় ও বিনিয়োগ শুরু করা ভালো? এর সহজ উত্তর হলো, যত আগে শুরু করবেন, ততই ভালো। আমাদের মধ্যে একটা ধারণা থাকতে পারে—এখনো চাকরি করা শুরু করিনি, এখনই কিসের টাকা জমানো? টাকা উপার্জন করা শুরু করি, তারপর জমানোর বিষয়টা দেখা যাবে। আবার এমন হতে পারে, কেবল চাকরি শুরু করেছি, কয়েক বছর যাক, তারপর জমানো শুরু করব। এই করে করে অনেকটা সময় চলে যায়; কিন্তু জমানো আর শুরু হয়নি।

এদিকে সময়ের সঙ্গে সঙ্গে দায়িত্ব বাড়তে থাকে এবং আয়ের সঙ্গে পাল্লা দিয়ে খরচের পরিমাণও বাড়তে থাকে। কয়েক বছর আগে টাকা জমানো যতটা সহজ হতো, এখন দিনের পর দিন ততটাই অসম্ভব মনে হচ্ছে। কিন্তু আপনি জীবনের যে ধাপেই থাকুন না কেন, আপনার কাছে অসম্ভব মনে হলেও আপনি যখনই হাতে কিছু টাকা রয়ে যাবে, তা–ই সঞ্চয় করে ফেলুন। এভাবে আস্তে আস্তে দেখবেন, আপনার বেশ টাকা জমে গেছে। তাই একবার শুরুটা করুন.

টাকা জমানোর জন্য সবচেয়ে গুরুত্বপূর্ণ হলো, লক্ষ্য ঠিক করা। আপনি জমানো টাকা দিয়ে কী করতে চাচ্ছেন, তা যদি ঠিক থাকে, তাহলে দেখা যাবে, আপনার টাকা সঞ্চয়ের আগ্রহটা বাড়বে। এবং আপনি নিয়মিত যেকোনো পরিমাণই হোক তা আপনি জমানোর চেষ্টা করবেন। তবে এ ক্ষেত্রে আপনি আপনার লক্ষ্যকে দুটি ভাগে ভাগ করে নিতে পারেন। স্বল্পমেয়াদি এবং দীর্ঘমেয়াদি পরিকল্পনা।

স্বল্পমেয়াদি পরিকল্পনা হলো, আগামী এক বছরের মধ্যে আপনি জমানো টাকা দিয়ে কী করতে চাচ্ছেন? যেমন হতে পারে আপনি একটি স্মার্টফোন বা ক্যামেরা কিনতে চাচ্ছেন, আপনি আপনার পছন্দের কোনো জায়গায় ঘুরতে যেতে চাচ্ছেন ইত্যাদি। আর দীর্ঘমেয়াদি পরিকল্পনা হতে পারে, আগামী পাঁচ বছর বা তার বেশি সময় পর আপনি জমানো টাকা দিয়ে কী করতে চাচ্ছেন। এ ক্ষেত্রে হতে পারে, পড়া শেষ করে চাকরি না করে আপনি নিজেই একটা কিছু করতে চাচ্ছেন। আবার হতে পারে আপনি এখন ভাড়া বাসায় থাকেন। কিন্তু পাঁচ বছর পর জমানো টাকা দিয়ে ফ্ল্যাটের কিস্তি দিতে চাচ্ছেন ইত্যাদি।

বিশেষজ্ঞরা বাবা-মাকে পরামর্শ দেন, তাঁরা যেন তাঁদের বাচ্চাদের সঞ্চয় করার মানসিকতা তৈরি করেন। এতে তারা অল্প অল্প করে যখন শুরু করবে। তখন তারা জীবনের যেকোনো সময় খরচের পর হাতে সামান্য কিছু থেকে গেলও তা–ই তারা জমাতে দ্বিধা করবে না। এ জন্য আপনি বাচ্চাদের মাটির ব্যাংক কিনে দিতে পারেন। এবং প্রতিদিন বাসায় ফিরে খুচরা যে টাকা থাকবে, তা তাদের হাতে দিতে পারেন, ওই মাটির ব্যাংকে জমানোর জন্য এবং একটা বিশেষ দিনে এই মাটির ব্যাংক ভেঙে তা দিয়ে ভালো একটা কিছু করার অভ্যাস তৈরি করতে পারেন। তাই সময়ের জন্য অপেক্ষা না করে এখন থেকেই আপনি সঞ্চয় শুরু করে দিন। আপনার যেকোনো বয়সই হোক না কেন, তা বিষয় নয়।

যুক্তরাষ্ট্রের সিএনএন মানি বয়সকে চারটি ধাপে ভাগ করে কোন ধাপে কত করে জমাতে হবে তার একটি হিসাব দেখিয়েছে। এখানে বলা হয়েছে, জীবনে সফল হওয়ার জন্য আপনি যেমন লক্ষ্য ঠিক করেন, তেমনি আপনি যদি ঠিক করেন আপনি মিলিয়নেয়ার হবেন, তাহলে তা কঠিন কিছুই হবে না। কিছু সাধারণ নিয়ম আছে যা মেনে চললে এ ক্ষেত্রে সফল হওয়া যাবে।

চলুন জেনে নিই মিলিয়নেয়ার হতে চাইলে কোন বয়সে আমেরিকানদের কত করে জমাতে হবে।

২৫ বছর বয়সে

টাকা জমানোর ক্ষেত্রে ২৫ বছর বয়স হলো সবচেয়ে ভালো একটা সময়। এ সময় থেকেই যদি শুরু করা যায়, তাহলে মাসে খুবই অল্প জমিয়ে সেই লক্ষ্য অর্জন করা খুবই সহজ হবে।

মাত্র ১৭৫ ডলার করে জমালে ৬৫ বছর বয়সে যখন কেউ অবসর নেবেন, তখন তিনি হয়ে যাবেন একজন মিলিয়নেয়ার। প্রতি মাসে ১৭৫ ডলার করে জমালে আগামী ৪০ বছরে দিতে হবে মাত্র ৮৪ হাজার ডলার। আর বাকি ৯ লাখ ১৬ হাজার ডলার আসবে জমানো অর্থের রিটার্ন থেকে। তবে কেউ যদি মাসে এই পরিমাণ ডলারও জমাতে না পারেন, তাহলে যে পরিমাণেই পারেন তা যত ছোট অঙ্কই হোক তা দিয়েই শুরু করা বুদ্ধিমানের কাজ হবে।

৩৫ বছর বয়সে

যাদের বয়স এখন ৩৫ এবং এখনো কোনো সঞ্চয় নেই, তাঁদের মাসিক জমানোর পরিমাণ দুই গুণের থেকেও বেশি হবে ২৫ বছর বয়সীদের তুলনায়। ৩৫ বছর বয়সীদের মাসে জমাতে হবে ৪৭০ ডলার করে। মাসে এই পরিমাণ ডলার জমালে আগামী ৩০ বছরে জমা হবে ১ লাখ ৬৯ হাজার ডলার। আর মিলিয়নেয়ার হতে বাকিটা আসবে তাঁর জমানো অর্থের রিটার্ন থেকে।

৪৫ বছর বয়সে

এই বয়সে কেউ যদি মিলিয়নেয়ার হতে চায়, তাহলে তাঁকে জমাতে হবে মাসে ১ হাজার ৩৩০ ডলার করে। তাহলে আগামী ২০ বছরে তাঁর জমবে ৩ লাখ ১৯ হাজার ডলার। বাকি ডলার আসবে রিটার্ন থেকে।

৫৫ বছর বয়সে

যাঁদের বয়স ৫৫ কিন্তু কোনো সঞ্চয় নেই, তাঁদের জমানোর পরিমাণ স্বাভাবিকভাবেই অন্যদের তুলনায় খুবই বেশি হবে। মাসে ৪ হাজার ৮০০ ডলার করে আগামী ১০ বছর জমালে, একজন আমেরিকান ৬৫ বছর বয়সে মিলিয়নেয়ার হবেন। তাঁকে ১০ বছরে দিতে হবে ৫ লাখ ৭৬ হাজার ডলার; এবং বাকিটা আসবে তার রিটার্ন থেকে।�ওপরে আমেরিকানদের জন্য এই হিসাব দেওয়া হয়েছে। এক মিলিয়ন (১০ লাখ) ইউএস ডলার বাংলাদেশি টাকায় ১০ কোটি টাকা (প্রতি ডলার ১০০ টাকা ধরে)। আপনি ১০ কোটি টাকার জায়গায় ১ কোটি টাকা জমানোর লক্ষ্য ঠিক করতে পারেন। তবে যদি এর বেশি জমাতে পারেন, তাহলে আপনার জন্য আরও ভালো।

বর্তমান সময়ে আবার জমাব কী, যে আয় হয় তা দিয়ে সংসার খরচ চালিয়ে হাতে কিছুই থাকে না, যাঁরা এ কথা বলছেন, তাঁরা লক্ষ্য করুন, আপনি যদি ১৭৫ ডলারের স্থলে মাসে ১৭৫ টাকা করে সঞ্চয় করেন, তাহলে ৬৫ বছর বয়সে আপনি যখন অবসরে যাবেন, তখন আপনার হাতে ১০ লাখ টাকা থাকবে। শূন্য হাতে অবসরে যাওয়ার চেয়ে ১০ লাখ টাকা হাতে থাকা অনেক বড় একটা বিষয়।

আপনি যদি ১৭৫ টাকা থেকে আরও বেশি পরিমাণে জমাতে পারেন, তাহলে দীর্ঘ সময় পর অবশ্যই আপনার আরও বেশি টাকা জমবে। আপনি আরেকটা সহজ উপায় বের করে নিতে পারেন। আপনার বয়স যদি এখন ২৫ বছর হয়, তাহলে আপনি যে আয় করছেন, তা যদি খরচ হয়ে যায়, তাহলে আপনি মাসে অন্তত ৫০০ টাকা সঞ্চয়ের একটা প্ল্যান ঠিক করতে পারেন। এই ৫০০ টাকা আপনি একসঙ্গে আলাদা না করে সাপ্তাহিক ভিত্তিতে আলাদা করে রাখুন। তাহলে প্রতি সপ্তাহে ১২৫ টাকা করে আলাদাভাবে সরিয়ে রাখতে হবে। সপ্তাহে যেদিন বাজার করবেন, ওই দিন আপনি এই ১২৫ টাকা আলাদা করে রেখে দেবেন। তাহলে দেখবেন ৪ সপ্তাহে আপনার ৫০০ টাকা জমা হয়ে গেছে। এই ৫০০ টাকা দিয়ে আপনি আপাতত একটা ডিপিএস শুরু করুন।

আপনি ১৭৫ টাকা মাসে সঞ্চয় করলে ৬৫ বছর বয়সে ১০ লাখ টাকা পাচ্ছেন। আর যদি মাসে ৫০০ টাকা করে সঞ্চয় করতে পারেন, তাহলে এই একই সময়ে প্রায় সাড়ে ২৮ লাখ টাকা পেতে পারেন। এ টাকা দিয়ে আপনি ভালো একটা কাজ করতে পারবেন বা অবসরে যাওয়ার পর ছেলেমেয়ে টাকা দেবে কি না, এ চিন্তা করতে হবে না। বরং আপনি অবসরে গিয়েও ছেলেমেয়েকে তাদের দরকারের সময় টাকা দিয়ে সাহায্য করতে পারবেন। তবে যেটা মনে রাখতে হবে, আপনি যত আগে এই সঞ্চয় করা শুরু করবেন, তত ভালো অবস্থানে থাকবেন।

প্রথম আলো থেকে সংগৃহীত...

meta.rank_math_description: কোন বয়সে সঞ্চয় ও বিনিয়োগ শুরু করা ভালো? এর সহজ উত্তর হলো, যত আগে শুরু করবেন, ততই ভালো। আমাদের মধ্যে একটা ধারণা থাকতে পারে—এখনো চাকরি করা শুরু করিনি, এখনই কিসের টাকা জমানো? টাকা উপার্জন করা শুরু করি, তারপর জমানোর বিষয়টা দেখা যাবে। আবার এমন হতে পারে, কেবল চাকরি শুরু করেছি, কয়েক বছর যাক, তারপর জমানো শুরু করব। এই করে করে অনেকটা সময় চলে যায়; কিন্তু জমানো আর শুরু হয়নি।

blog_posts.title: How to make earthquake resistant buildings in Dhaka? Importance and process of construction of earthquake resistant buildings
blog_posts.content:
How to make earthquake resistant buildings in Dhaka? Importance and process of construction of earthquake resistant buildings

Recently, the issue of safety in building construction came into discussion after the huge casualties in the earthquake in Turkey. 

A building's ability to withstand an earthquake depends on several factors. They include structure, materials used and design. Also, the construction process plays an important role in building earthquake resistant buildings.

In earlier times buildings were constructed close to the ground. They did not reach much height. There was an opportunity to run into the open to prevent further damage. However, current high-rises are jam-packed close to each other. There is no alternative but to build earthquake resistant buildings. After all, the structure must withstand natural disasters.

 

The mere mention of an earthquake does not paint a positive picture in anyone's mind. In fact, earthquakes are one of the most destructive forces. Seismic ground waves can easily kill people. Moreover, they destroy buildings and spend huge sums of money on repairs.

 

Engineers and architects are on a constant roll to come up with new technologies. There are several implementations for earthquake resistant structures. Let's know more about earthquake resistant building construction.

How do earthquakes affect buildings?

In this blog we will understand the characteristics of earthquake resistant buildings. Moreover, we will see how to build earthquake resistant buildings. But first, let's understand how earthquakes affect man-made structures. When an earthquake occurs, the force created by the earthquake moves through the ground and shakes it. The energy spreads out in all directions in short bursts.

Buildings are built to withstand vertical forces such as wind and rain. Unfortunately, they cannot handle the forces released by earthquakes.

Horizontal waves lead to vibrations. They affect the columns, walls, floors, connectors and beams of a building. A disparity comes in the movement up and down the building. Which puts extreme pressure on construction. Then, this further leads to rupture in the supporting frame. The building eventually collapsed. So earthquake resistant buildings are the need of the hour.

Can buildings really be earthquake proof?

No 100% earthquake resistant building exists anywhere in this world. Engineers and archaeologists are still trying to find something that is stronger than Earth. Scientifically-supported design processes capitalize on the knowledge we have gained about earthquakes. This knowledge has given us the ability to build earthquake resistant buildings. The effects of disasters like earthquakes can be handled quite well. Especially the construction of earthquake resistant buildings.

How to make earthquake resistant buildings?

The ability of buildings to withstand earthquakes depends on several factors. They include structure, materials used and design. Also, the construction process plays a role in building earthquake resistant buildings.

Structures that are typically designed to resist earthquake forces have a variety of basic configurations. These earthquake resistant structures are made of special materials and beams. This is to absorb the shockwaves of these earthquakes. The elements and beams of earthquake resistant buildings absorb these earthquake shockwaves. Also, earthquakes emit waves that strike buildings in a specific direction. So, the plan involves building earthquake-resistant buildings by pushing them in opposite directions.

Following are some ways to make earthquake resistant buildings:

Create a flexible foundation:

It is one of the ways to make earthquake resistant buildings. If you want to resist earthquake energy waves, climb the foundation of the building above the earth. This is done through a practice called base isolation.

Base isolation is a process that involves constructing earthquake resistant buildings on flexible pads. Moreover, such pads are usually made from rubber, steel and lead. So, when the foundation of the building moves during an earthquake, the isolators below it move. Meanwhile, the entire structure of the building remains stable.

The method is effective in absorbing seismic waves. This prevents them from traveling further up the building. So buildings are being made earthquake resistant structures.

Strengthen the structure of the construction:

There is another way to make earthquake resistant buildings. It strengthens their structure. To prevent crashes, structures must restructure the energy traveling through them during an earthquake. You can use cross braces and shear walls to construct earthquake resistant buildings. Moment-resisting frames, and diaphragms, are also important for strengthening a building.

Shear wall

Shear walls are effective building technology. They can help transfer shockwaves from earthquakes. They are made of multiple panels. They help the building maintain its shape during earthquakes. These walls are often supported by diagonal cross braces. These braces are made of steel. They hold tension and contraction. It helps resist shock and stress.

Moment Resisting Frame   Moment resisting frames provide additional plasticity to the design of the building. The structure is placed between construction joints. Further, it allows bending of beams and columns. Meanwhile, the joints themselves remain rigid. Therefore, the constructions are capable of resisting shockwaves from earthquakes.  

Diaphragm

Diaphragms are also a central part of the construction structure. Place roofs, decks and building sills on top of structures. It helps to get rid of tension from the floor. Along with this, it also helps to relieve tension in the vertical fabric of the building from push forces.


Building shields from vibrations

Another way to make buildings earthquake resistant is to redirect energy from earthquakes. The focus is not only on resisting the balance of forces. Researchers are trying to find ways that buildings can completely deflect and reroute the energy from shockwaves.

The method of making earthquake resistant structures is called Seismic Invisibility Cloak. The process includes 100 concrete rings and a cloak of concentric plastic. Then buried under the foundation of the building. Also, the seismic invisibility cloak needs to be at least three feet below the foundation.

There is an innovative idea behind the sheet. When seismic waves enter the ring, the ease of travel will force them to pass through the outer ring. As a result, the waves would move away from the building. Then, they will spread to the ground.

Earthquake resistant materials

It is important to construct earthquake resistant buildings using strong materials. They can help prevent shockwaves from disrupting the building's structure. So, shock absorbers, pendulums and invisibility cloaks are important. They help redirect energy to the extent of the materials used to construct the building.

To build an earthquake-resistant structure, you need to seriously consider the materials used for construction. Below are the common materials used in the construction of earthquake resistant buildings.

Wood and Steel: For a material to resist vibration and tension, it needs to have high ductility. This means that it has the ability to withstand large deformations and stresses. Modern constructions are often constructed of structural steel. It is a material that comes in many forms. Structural steel allows buildings to bend without breaking. Also, wood is a relatively flexible material. This is because of its high energy. Also, it has a light texture.

Innovative Materials: Scientists are developing new materials that have greater ability to hold their shape. New innovations such as shape memory alloys have arrived. Shape memory alloy has the strength to withstand extreme tension. Moreover, it returns to its original shape.

Fiber-reinforced plastic wraps are made of numerous polymers. They can be wrapped around building columns. It offers 38% of its core strength with flexibility.

All in all, it is very necessary to have earthquake resistant buildings in Bangladesh. Such structures can ensure complete safety for you and your loved ones.
